meanings.definition: Not able to be absorbed or integrated into a group or culture.
meanings.sent1: The new student's unique traditions were seen as unassimilable by the rest of the class.
meanings.sent2: The foreign language was so unassimilable that it posed a challenge for the students.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fit a square peg into a round hole is as unassimilable as wearing flip-flops in the snow.
meanings.sent4: Her rebellious spirit was like an unassimilable puzzle to her conservative family.
meanings.sent5: The bright purple hair was an unassimilable sight in the sea of natural colors.

meanings.definition: Not able to be digested or metabolized.
meanings.sent1: The tough meat was unassimilable by his sensitive stomach.
meanings.sent2: The foreign substance in the food was unassimilable and caused an allergic reaction.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to eat the whole cake in one sitting proved to be unassimilable for his stomach.
meanings.sent4: The complex protein was an unassimilable challenge for the body to break down.
meanings.sent5: The expired milk had an unassimilable taste that made her gag.

meanings.definition: Not able to be understood or comprehended.
meanings.sent1: The professor's lecture on quantum physics was unassimilable to the elementary school students.
meanings.sent2: The ancient text was written in a language that was unassimilable without a translator.
meanings.sent3: Trying to explain the concept of time dilation to a toddler is as unassimilable as teaching a fish to ride a bicycle.
meanings.sent4: The abstract artwork was unassimilable to those who preferred realistic paintings.
meanings.sent5: The complex mathematical equation seemed unassimilable until she finally understood its beauty.
